about.title: ‚ÑπÔ∏è About re-frame
about.mission: Mission ‚Äì give people who struggle with avoidant patterns a gentle way to challenge harsh thoughts‚Äîwithout shame, ads, or data mining.
about.what_it_is_desc: a therapeutic framework-informed cognitive restructuring tool that spots thinking traps (catastrophising, mind-reading, etc.) and offers kinder perspectives.
about.what_it_isnt_desc: full psychotherapy, medical advice, or a crisis service.
about.who_builds_desc: just me‚ÄîCarlos, a software engineer who's lived with AvPD for years and is investing my own time, skills, and will to create the tool I wish I'd had.
about.why_open_source_desc: transparency builds trust; anyone can inspect or improve the code.
about.open_source_desc: The entire codebase is open-source and available on GitHub. You can see exactly how your data is handled (it isn't stored) and how the AI generates responses.
about.no_tracking_desc: We don't use analytics, store conversations, or track you across the web. Your sessions are completely private.
about.research_backed_desc: Built on evidence-based cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) techniques specifically helpful for avoidant patterns and social anxiety.
about.not_replacement: This is not a replacement for professional therapy or medical treatment.
about.crisis_warning: If you're in crisis, please contact your local emergency services or a crisis helpline.
about.getting_help: If you're looking for professional support, consider reaching out to a qualified therapist who specializes in CBT or personality disorders.

learn_cbt.title: What is CBT?
learn_cbt.intro: Cognitive Behavioural Therapy (CBT) is an evidence-based approach that links thoughts, feelings, and actions. By spotting common thinking traps‚Äîsuch as catastrophising, mind-reading, or "all-or-nothing" statements‚Äîyou can practise kinder, more balanced perspectives.
learn_cbt.why_helps_intro: People living with Avoidant Personality Disorder often battle intense self-criticism and fear of negative evaluation. CBT offers practical tools to:
learn_cbt.name_thoughts: Name unhelpful thoughts rather than accept them as facts.
learn_cbt.test_thoughts: Test those thoughts against real-world evidence.
learn_cbt.practice_alternatives: Practise alternative interpretations in small, safe steps.
learn_cbt.catastrophising_desc: Assuming the worst possible outcome will happen.
learn_cbt.mind_reading_desc: Believing you know what others are thinking about you.
learn_cbt.all_or_nothing_desc: Seeing situations in black and white terms only.
learn_cbt.personalisation_desc: Blaming yourself for things outside your control.
learn_cbt.getting_started_desc: Start by simply noticing your thoughts without judgment. When you catch yourself in a thinking trap, gently ask: "Is there another way to look at this situation?"
learn_cbt.beck_reference: Beck, J. S. (2011). Cognitive behavior therapy: Basics and beyond (2nd ed.).
learn_cbt.avpd_reference: Lampe, L., & Malhi, G. S. (2018). Avoidant personality disorder: current insights.
learn_cbt.exposure_reference: Wolitzky-Taylor, K. B., et al. (2008). Psychological approaches in the treatment of specific phobias.
